title: Platform team model
summary: A dedicated team that owns the integration platform as a product and provides paved roads for others.

decisionGuidance.problemSolved: Without a platform team, standards drift and every team re-solves reliability and security.
whenToUse: You want repeatable patterns and guardrails
whenNotToUse: A single team owns all delivery and will remain so

gotchas: Platform team becomes a bottleneck if it builds everything
thingsToWatchOutFor.opinionatedGuidance: Platform team builds the platform, not all integrations. Enable product teams to deliver.

complexity.rationale: Org design and product ownership are the hard parts.
complexity.operationalDemand: Highâ€”platform team impacts ops reliability across the org.
complexity.toolingDemand: Templates, CI/CD standards, and policy tooling.

realWorldExample.approach: Created a platform backlog and a consumer feedback loop.
